The Gannets

45.47.text:
One of the virtues 
of true science

50.83.text:

Now, these Nazca boobies

67.47.text:

70.80.text:
and I suppose

72.97.text:
from a Darwinian point of view

76.97.text:

87.70.text:

The parent makes no effort

96.07.text:

99.37.text:

104.43.text:

109.67.text:
The elder sibling 
doesn't kill the younger one,

114.10.text:

124.97.text: This is more a subtle kind of insurance policy,

129.77.text:

134.17.text:
Bringing two chicks 
into the world

135.83.text:
so that one may die 
seems horribly cruel to us,

139.87.text:
but natural selection 
has no pity.

142.30.text:
The genes that implement 
this callous insurance policy

145.80.text:
get passed down 
through the generations

147.63.text:
in the bodies 
of the surviving chicks,

149.80.text:
usually the elder one, 
sometimes the younger one.
